alert.note: Alert for Creek; Pawnee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 21 at 2:09PM CST until December 22 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 6 PM CST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM THURSDAY TO NOON CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected Thursday into Thursday night behind an Arctic cold front with wind chills 20 to 30 degrees below zero by Friday morning. For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation will quickly transition to snow behind the front. Total snow accumulations up to 1 inch and a light glaze of ice will be possible. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph can be expected. * WHERE...Pawnee and Creek Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 4 AM Thursday to noon CST Friday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM to 6 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact travel. Cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Near blizzard conditions will briefly be possible behind the front with greatly reduced visibilities.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 1-844-465-4997 or go to okRoads.org.
